definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: The long-distance runner was dead beat as he crossed the finishing line.
sentences.chinese: 長跑運動員在衝過終點線時已筋疲力盡。

sentences.english: Don't run yourself silly and end up on the sideline instead of crossing the finish line.
sentences.chinese: 不要傻跑，別跑到馬路邊上去，您應該衝過終點線。

sentences.english: The feeling of accomplishment when you cross the finish line is unbeatable.
sentences.chinese: 那完成比賽衝過終點線時的感覺真是無與倫比。

sentences.english: When the athlete breaks through the goal line, the aimer must in its behind.
sentences.chinese: 當運動員衝過終點線時，引導員必須在其後面。

sentences.english: He redoubled his speed when he saw the finishing line ahead.
sentences.chinese: 當他看到前面的終點線時，他大大地加快了速度。

sentences.english: When it was over, two men lay still at the finish line.
sentences.chinese: 當一切結束的時候，兩個男人仍然躺在終點線。

sentences.english: The boy crosses the finish line and looks back at me.
sentences.chinese: 這個男孩越過了終點線並且回頭看了看我。

sentences.english: They were in the lead . The finish line was close.
sentences.chinese: 他們目前居於領先地位，終點線就在前面不遠了。

sentences.english: Ironically, we do have a sense where the finish line is.
sentences.chinese: 具有諷刺意味的是，我們對終點線其實是有感覺的。

sentences.english: They were rowed out and slumped over their oars at the finish line.
sentences.chinese: 他們已經劃得精疲力竭，一到終點線便伏倒在槳上。

sentences.english: At last he overtook me at the finishing line.
sentences.chinese: 在到達終點線時他超過了我。

sentences.english: The exhausted runner gasped when he dashed to the finishing line.
sentences.chinese: 筋疲力盡的賽跑運動員在衝向終點線時直喘氣。

sentences.english: The racers sprinted towards the finish line.
You keep on getting right to the finish line and then you stop.
sentences.chinese: 你不斷調整前進的方向，卻在終點線上止步不前。

sentences.english: We cheered as he neared the finish line.
sentences.chinese: 當他接近終點線時，我們喝起採來。

sentences.english: The red racing boat crossed the finish line first.
sentences.chinese: 那條紅色的賽船第一個衝過了終點線。

definition: to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
on call/always available/ready at all times
lit. plaintive whine of geese (idiom); fig. land swarming with disaster victims/starving people fill the land
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
to give a small demonstration of one's impressive skills (idiom)
to make do in difficult circumstances by being resourceful/(of circumstances) difficult/challenging/(of a budget) tight/(of a man-made thing) makeshift/rough and ready
to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
